messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] re:must reads
messages.msgSnippet: ... From: camden ccoutlaw@direcway.com I was searching for books from the list you had posted & can t find one.  Is the book John Taylor Gatto s _Dumbing Us
messages.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: camden ccoutlaw@...

I was searching for books from the list you had posted & can't find one. Is the
book John Taylor Gatto's _Dumbing Us Down_ and The Underground History of
> American Education retitled? I can't find it, the only title I can find is
Dumbing Us Down: The Hidden Curriculum of Compulsory Schooling, Vol. 1 &
Dumbing Us Down: The Hidden Curriculum of Compulsory Education

Are these different books? I'd love to add it to my reading list but just can't
find it !

Help !!

-=-=-=-

I'm just getting around to answering a zillion old e-mails that have been queuing up for weeks. I came across this one that I never even read! <g> Sorry!

They are two different books. _Dumbing Us Down_ was his first, I believe.

_The Underground History of American Education_ is a very thick book that can be read online. Try here: http://www.johntaylorgatto.com/underground/

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] re:must reads
messages.msgSnippet: I was  searching for books from the list you had posted & can t find ... ************ I read the Underground History on his website _www.johntaylorgatto.com_
messages.messageBody:
I was searching for books from the list you had posted & can't find
> one. Is the book John Taylor Gatto's _Dumbing Us Down_ and The
> Underground History of
>> American Education retitled?



************

I read the Underground History on his website _www.johntaylorgatto.com_
(http://www.johntaylorgatto.com) for free! Don't know if it is still there.

It took awhile, but I enjoyed it. I have never read the complete Dumbing Us
Down, just exerpts.

Leslie in SC

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] re:must reads
messages.msgSnippet: Two different books. I recommend Dumbing Us Down: Hidden Curriculum.......... and not the history book unless you have a burning desire to spend hours and
messages.messageBody:
Two different books.

I recommend "Dumbing Us Down: Hidden Curriculum.........." and not
the history book unless you have a burning desire to spend hours and
hours and HOURS immersed in a New Yorker's very in-depth view of how
public school has developed over the years.

-pam

On Dec 17, 2005, at 8:33 PM, camden wrote:

> I was searching for books from the list you had posted & can't find
> one. Is the book John Taylor Gatto's _Dumbing Us Down_ and The
> Underground History of
>> American Education retitled?
